org.gridgain.grid.spi.cloud.ec2lite
Class GridEc2LiteCloudSpi

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.spi.GridSpiAdapter
      org.gridgain.grid.spi.cloud.ec2lite.GridEc2LiteCloudSpi
All Implemented Interfaces:
GridEc2LiteCloudSpiMBean, GridCloudSpi, GridSpi, GridSpiJsonConfigurable, GridSpiManagementMBean
@GridSpiInfo(author="GridGain Systems, Inc.",
             url="www.gridgain.com",
             email="support@gridgain.com",
             version="3.1.1c.12072011")
@GridSpiMultipleInstancesSupport(value=true)
public class GridEc2LiteCloudSpi
extends GridSpiAdapter
implements GridCloudSpi, GridEc2LiteCloudSpiMBean

This class defines EC2-based implementation for GridCloudSpi. It supports seven actions:

  1. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.RUN_INST_ACT run new Amazon EC2 instances;
  2. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.TERMINATE_INST_ACT terminate Amazon EC2 instances;
  3. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.TERMINATE_ALL_INST_ACT terminate all Amazon EC2 instances;
  4. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.STOP_INST_ACT stop Amazon EC2 instances;
  5. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.STOP_ALL_INST_ACT stop all Amazon EC2 instances;
  6. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.START_INST_ACT start Amazon EC2 instances;
  7. GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.START_ALL_INST_ACT start all Amazon EC2 instances.

See below for details on each command.

For information about Amazon EC2 visit aws.amazon.com.

Attention

You can configure only one cloud within one Amazon EC2 account. Be very careful when using commands that affects all instances since execution will affect all instances within account (not cloud as it may seem).

The most safe usage of EC2 clouds is when you run only cloud within one Amazon EC2 account. If you want to add more clouds you should run them under separate accounts. If you use Amazon EC2 for goals other than running clouds it is recommended you use separate accounts for that.

Warning

Note that accessing Amazon EC2 service (i.e. running instances within) will result in charges to your Amazon EC2 account.

Set test mode of the SPI to true to avoid calls (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setTestMode(boolean)).

Configuration

Mandatory

This SPI has no mandatory configuration parameters:

Optional

This SPI has following optional configuration parameters:
  • Cloud ID (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setCloudId(String))
  • State check frequency (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setStateCheckFrequency(long), GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.MIN_STATE_CHECK_FREQ)
  • Access key ID (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setAccessKeyId(String), GridEc2Helper.getEc2Credentials(String))
  • Secret access key (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setSecretAccessKey(String), GridEc2Helper.getEc2Credentials(String))
  • Proxy host (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setProxyHost(String))
  • Proxy port (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setProxyPort(int))
  • Proxy user name (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setProxyUsername(String))
  • Proxy password (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setProxyPassword(String))
  • Image IDs (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setImageIds(List))
  • Enable monitoring by default (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setEnableMonitoring(boolean))

Commands

Following commands are supported:
Command Parameter Description
Run Instance(s)

Runs one or more EC2 instances within EC2 account.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.RUN_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Value greater than zero indicating how many nodes to start. If less or equal to zero exception is thrown.
GridCloudCommand.resources() Collection containing one and only one GridCloudResourceType.CLD_IMAGE resource and zero or more GridCloudResourceType.CLD_SECURITY_GROUP resources. Other resources types as well as other combinations are not allowed - exception will be thrown by GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.process(GridCloudCommand, UUID).
GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not run any instances).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_TYPE - Instance type (refer to Amazon EC2 API reference).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_PLACEMENT - Instance placement (refer to Amazon EC2 API reference).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_KEY_PAIR_NAME - Key pair name (refer to Amazon EC2 API reference).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_PASS_EC2_KEYS - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI will pass EC2 access credentials to instance via user data.
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_MAIN_S3_BUCKET - Main S3 bucket for instance (passed via user data).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_USER_S3_BUCKET - User S3 bucket for instance (passed via user data).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_JVM_OPTS - JVM options for instance (refer to Amazon EC2 API reference).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_MON - By providing true or false string default monitor setting may be overridden (see GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.setEnableMonitoring(boolean)).
Terminate instance (s)

Terminates instances.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.TERMINATE_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Value greater or equal to zero. The value indicates how many instances to terminate. See below for further details.
GridCloudCommand.resources() Not null and not empty collection.
Two variants are possible:
  1. Collection containing the only element - resource of type GridCloudResourceType.CLD_IMAGE. In this case GridCloudCommand.number() shows how many instances created out of this image to terminate.
  2. Collection containing resources of type GridCloudResourceType.CLD_INSTANCE. in this case GridCloudCommand.number() should be zero or equal to GridCloudCommand.resources() size; if not then exception is thrown)

SPI will search instances to terminate by a command among instances that are currently in one of the following states GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_PENDING_STATE, GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_RUNNING_STATE, GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPING_STATE or GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPED_STATE. If concrete instances were provided but not found among instances with above states then exception is thrown.

If cloud has less instances than it is required to terminate by a command then exception is thrown at command execution time.

GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not, SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not terminate any instances).
Terminate all instances.

Terminates all instances in the cloud that are currently in one of the following states GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_PENDING_STATE, GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_RUNNING_STATE, GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPING_STATE or GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPED_STATE.

If cloud has no instances to terminate then this command is no-op.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.TERMINATE_ALL_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Any value. Will be ignored silently.
GridCloudCommand.resources() Any value. Will be ignored silently.
GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not, SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, than SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not terminate any instances).
Stop instance (s)

Stops instances.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.STOP_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Value greater or equal to zero. If not zero then should be equal to GridCloudCommand.resources() size (if not then exception is thrown).
GridCloudCommand.resources() Not null and not empty collection containing resources of type GridCloudResourceType.CLD_INSTANCE representing instances that are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_RUNNING_STATE state.

SPI will search instances to terminate by a command among instances that are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_RUNNING_STATE state. If provided instances were not found within running instances then exception is thrown at command execution time.

GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not, SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not stop any instances).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.FORCE_STOP - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then instances are forced to stop (refer to Amazon EC2 API reference).
Stop all instances.

Stops all instances in the cloud That are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_RUNNING_STATE state.

If cloud has no running instances then this command is no-op.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.STOP_ALL_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Any value. Will be ignored silently.
GridCloudCommand.resources() Any value. Will be ignored silently.
GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not, SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not stop any instances).
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.FORCE_STOP - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then instances are forced to stop (refer to Amazon EC2 API reference).
Start instance (s)

Starts instances that are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPED_STATE.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.START_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Value greater or equal to zero. If not zero then should be equal to GridCloudCommand.resources() size (if not then exception is thrown).
GridCloudCommand.resources() Not null and not empty collection containing resources of type GridCloudResourceType.CLD_INSTANCE representing instances that are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPED_STATE state.

SPI will search instances to terminate by a command among instances that are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPED_STATE state. If provided instances were not found within stopped instances then exception is thrown at command execution time.

GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not, SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not start any instances).
Start all instances.

Starts all instances in the cloud That are currently in GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.INST_STOPPED_STATE state.

If cloud has no stopped instances then this command is no-op.

GridCloudCommand.action() Should return GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.STOP_ALL_INST_ACT
GridCloudCommand.number() Any value. Will be ignored silently.
GridCloudCommand.resources() Any value. Will be ignored silently.
GridCloudCommand.parameters() Command parameters map. May be null or empty. If not, SPI handles the following keys:
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi.CMD_DRY_RUN_KEY - If provided and Boolean.parseBoolean(String) returns true, then SPI goes through all the motions of running a command, but makes no actual changes (does not start any instances).

If command's action is not recognized exception is thrown by SPI.

Java Example

GridEc2LiteCloudSpi can be configured as follows: 
 GridEc2LiteCloudSpi cloudSpi = new GridEc2LiteCloudSpi();

 // Override default cloud ID.
 cloudSpi.setCloudId("myCloud");

 GridConfigurationAdapter cfg = new GridConfigurationAdapter();

 // Override default cloud SPI.
 cfg.setCloudSpi(cloudSpi);

 // Starts grid.
 G.start(cfg);

Spring Example

GridEc2LiteCloudSpi can be configured from Spring XML configuration file: 
 <bean id="grid.custom.cfg" class="org.gridgain.grid.GridConfigurationAdapter" singleton="true">
     ...
     <property name="cloudSpi">
         <bean class="org.gridgain.grid.spi.cloud.ec2lite.GridEc2LiteCloudSpi">
             <property name="cloudId" value="myCloud"/>
         </bean>
     </property>
     ...
 </bean>


For information about Spring framework visit www.springframework.org

getStateCheckFrequency

public long getStateCheckFrequency()

Specified by:
getStateCheckFrequency in interface GridEc2LiteCloudSpiMBean
Returns:
State check frequency.

@GridSpiConfiguration(optional=true)

isTestMode

public boolean isTestMode()
Gets if test mode is set or not. SPI will not call EC2 in test mode it will use mock to emulate calls.

Returns:
true if test mode is using, otherwise false.

setTestMode

public void setTestMode(boolean testMode)
Sets test mode. SPI will not call EC2 in test mode it will use mock to emulate calls.

Parameters:
testMode - true if test mode is using, otherwise false.

spiStart

public void spiStart(String gridName)
              throws GridSpiException
This method is called to start SPI. After this method returns successfully kernel assumes that SPI is fully operational.

Specified by:
spiStart in interface GridSpi
Throws:
GridSpiException - Throws in case of any error during SPI start.
Parameters:
gridName - Name of grid instance this SPI is being started for (null for default grid).

spiStop

public void spiStop()
             throws GridSpiException
This method is called to stop SPI. After this method returns kernel assumes that this SPI is finished and all resources acquired by it are released.

Note that this method can be called at any point including during recovery of failed start. It should make no assumptions on what state SPI will be in when this method is called.

Specified by:
spiStop in interface GridSpi
Throws:
GridSpiException - Thrown in case of any error during SPI stop.

compare

public Collection<GridTuple2<GridCloudResource,GridCloudSpiResourceAction>> compare(GridCloudSpiSnapshot oldSnp,
                                                                                    GridCloudSpiSnapshot newSnp)
Compares two snapshots and return delta (potentially empty but never null).

Specified by:
compare in interface GridCloudSpi
Parameters:
oldSnp - Old snapshot.
newSnp - New snapshot.
Returns:
Difference between snapshots. This method never returns null but may return an empty collection if snapshots are identical.
